title: 111_s1120
content: There is no information provided in the prev_chunk to summarize the curr_chunk "SECTION 1. HOPE AND LIFETIME LEARNING CREDIT." Section 25A of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to replace "qualified tuition and related expenses" with "higher education expenses" and define it as any expense considered in determining the cost of attendance at an eligible educational institution for courses of instruction. Conforming amendments are made to Section 6050S of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The amendments made to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 replace "qualified tuition and related expenses" with "higher education expenses" in various sections, including Section 6050S and Section 6724. These changes apply to expenses paid after December 31, 2008. SEC. 2. Amends section 72(t)(7) of the Internal Revenue Code to define higher education expenses for education. Effective for distributions after December 31, 2008. SEC. 3. Addresses qualified scholarships. SEC. 3. Qualified scholarships amended to define higher education expenses for tax purposes. Effective for amounts received after December 31, 2008. SEC. 4 amends the definition of qualified higher education expenses for income from US savings bonds. The changes apply to expenses paid after December 31, 2008. SEC. 5 amends the deduction for qualified tuition and related expenses to "higher education expenses" for taxable years beginning after December 31, 2008. SEC. 6 amends the definition of "qualified higher education expenses" for tax purposes, aligning it with the Higher Education Act of 1965. The amendment applies to taxable years starting after December 31, 2008.
